channel.title: Extended Downtime for Onion Services?
channel.description: I'm having persistent failures (at least two weeks) when trying to connect to Whonix and Qubes hidden services. I've double checked the addresses, but still have the same problem. Can anyone help?

item.title: Extended Downtime for Onion Services?
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
9jnc7:

Qubes 4.0 migration has been challenging.

I’m with you on that one.

Read full topic

item.title: Extended Downtime for Onion Services?
item.dc:creator: 9jnc7
item.description:
Hi @0brand,
Thanks for the support.

0brand:

There could be a few reasons why this is happening to you

  • Your Tor entry guard has rotated. The new guard has poor throughput
  • Tor and/or Qubes, Whonix v3 .onions are congested at the time of the day you are trying to connect

I didn’t think about that. The problem resolved itself a short time later. I’ve had issues like this since Tor introduced v3 onions. I guess it’s code problems or congestion issues.

0brand:

If so, are you able to update your system?

For the most part. I’ll just say the Qubes 4.0 migration has been challenging.

Read full topic

item.title: Extended Downtime for Onion Services?
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi 9jnc7

9jnc7:

I’m having persistent failures (at least two weeks) when trying to connect to Whonix and Qubes hidden services.

I have intermittent connectivity issues with Whonix and Qubes v3 onions but only lasting for a short time(a few hours). This is usually due to Tor congestion etc.

There could be a few reasons why this is happening to you

  • Your Tor entry guard has rotated. The new guard has poor throughput

  • Tor and/or Qubes, Whonix v3 .onions are congested at the time of the day you are trying to connect

  • Using the wrong Whonix and Qubes addresses

If you can connect to other v2 and v3 .onion hidden service I would say the problem is related to what I mentioned above.

Possible solutions

  • Try using the Whonix v3 links on this page to be sure you’re using the correct address.

    https://whonix.org/wiki/Forcing_.onion_on_Whonix.org

  • Try connecting to those addresses at different times of the day

One other thing. Have you onionized the Whonix repositories? If so, are you able to update your system?

Read full topic
